body.name: Dakine Split Roller 85L - Black, One Size
body.stockDetail: Only 13 left in stock - order soon.
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by Gritr.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 9 hrs 8 mins
features: A FULL-SIZE GEAR HAULER WITH THE SPLIT-LEVEL ORGANIZATION TO MATCH When the trip of a lifetime comes along, the Dakine Split Roller 85L travel bag gives you the space for that save-the-day rain gear and must-have gear, on top of all the other clothes you know you'll need.
The bag divides organization into a split-level design that gives easy access to multiple large compartments. It's like a traveling locker room that you can live out of while on the road.
Mesh dividers maintain visibility and the collapsible Split-Wing feature lets you compress the bag for easy storage when not in use.

Bomber Oversize zippers provide years of reliable closure, and durable wheels keep you rolling down sidewalks with ease. DIMENSIONS: - 5190 cubic inches (85L); - 30 x 14 x 13" (76 x 36 x 33cm); - 9lbs (4kg)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More than I expected
reviews.reviewText: I was searching to replace my old duffel style bag. Went to stores, shopped online for a month for an upcoming 10 day trip to Europe. This bag seemed great but my big concern with the brand was the size up from this was to big and this one seemed a little small. I don't do a lot of 10 day trips so didn't want a massive bag to drag around on week long trips. When it arrived it still looked a little small so I set out to pack it with everything I needed. Turns out it has ample room for me to take a ton of clothes. I did use compression bags for dirty clothes to keep the size down and to keep them separated from clean clothes. I even packed a dinner jacket in this that I had to bring for one night along with two additional pairs of shoes along with all the clothes, toiletries and power converters.I dragged this through the cobble stone streets with no problem. The wheels are large enough to handle that and partly built into the bag to protect them from the baggage handlers.I wasn't sure if the internal compartments was something I was going to like. Turned out to be a nice blessing when I had to change clothes in a parking lot. I knew right where everything was located and grabbed it quick. This kept everything from getting rolled into each other and difficult to find.The external front pockets are pretty narrow though. You can't fit allot in them. I was able to squeeze a pair of flip flops in the larger bottom compartment. The top compartment I used for loose change and receipts. Not much else I found I could use them for.The build quality is excellent. Great stitching on the handles which got grabbed and pulled from every angle. Granted it has only been on one 10 day trip but Europe can be hard on luggage if you are dragging it around. I didn't have any problems with the bag rolling over while pulling it. Not sure why it never rolled over given that this is a narrow bag. But didn't happen once.The weight on this is awesome. It weighs as much as my weekend bag with three times the room. I never came close to the 50lb limit for airlines.I wasn't sure it would stand on it's own as most duffle style bags don't but wasn't worried about it. To my surprise packed or empty it stands on its own.One of my travel companions is a very seasoned domestic and international traveler. He took a look at it and said this is his next bag. The only problem he and I had was we had to rent the largest car we could get to fit our bags in the trunk since the cars in this region were pretty tiny.The only down side I found to this bag is in the hotel room. When you put it on the luggage stand it can be hard to fit when it is completely open and you are trying to work out of both sides of it. I propped the luggage stand out a little from the wall and laid the top of the bag on the wall. A minor annoyance when trying to dig through the bag.The identity card in the side, I never used. I still used the handle one since I figured who is going to know that is there if my bag gets lost. It's pretty hidden and kind of a gimmick in my opinion.I would purchase again and recommend to friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this bag.
reviews.reviewText: Unique pattern. We have never seen another on the conveyor. Perfect size. Larger than a carry on but not huge like some of the bigger bags. compartments are awesome. Zip the two halves apart and both compartments are separate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The expandable sleeves are a bit tricky to place.Beautiful patternQuality materialSmooth to drag and push around even when heavySturdy luggage I'm satisfied

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great size, rolls smoothly, sturdy handle
reviews.reviewText: The bag is a good size for a week long trip. Definitely not carry on size. I love the two compartments makes it easy to keep folded clothes neat but still have the capacity of a duffle. The wheels roll smoothly and the handle seems pretty sturdy. Have only done one trip so I can’t speak to the durability yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for city dwellers
reviews.reviewText: 4 wheeled luggage is great for airports, but doesn't have the durability for curbs and staircases. This 2 wheeled luggage takes a beating for those who rely on city streets, staircases and mass transit. The hard back and soft top allows for easy under bed, sofa, dresser, etc storage. I understand those who complain about tipping, that problem is avoided by packing heavy items on the bottom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've had the larger version for years, taking it to many countries when I ride horses. I wanted to try the smaller version as stairs are often a challenge. I can get everything in this, if I also use a roll aboard- which I do for spare clothes in case my luggage is lost. So far so good. I'll update after a couple of trips

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Mme Pele would use it!
reviews.reviewText: A huge amount of space for a checked bag. Light, durable, and easy to wheel around. Very useful spaces inside. If it’s good enuff for the Goddess of Fire—it’s name is Hawaiian slang—it’s way good enuff for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's Da Kine, Brah
reviews.reviewText: I needed a big check-in piece of luggage and didn't want the run of the mill plastic stuff that I've traditionally had. I got this DaKine bag and really love it. I got it for longer surf trips but I first used it to go to a cold-weather wedding. I managed to pack two pairs of shoes, a suit, a peacoat, and the rest of my daily attire with room to spare. The compartments are great and there was even more room in the front pockets which I did not use. It rolled really smooth at the airport too and is just flat out way cooler to support a surf brand than some of these other haoles.

Der Koffer ist wirklich gut zum reisen, die Rollen sind schön verstaut was ein abbrechen verhindert wenn das Flughafenpersonal mal wieder Basketball mit den Koffern spielen sollte. Platzangebot und die Unterteilung der Fächer ist gut gelöst, wir haben bereits 2 dieser Koffer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Great bag with lot of capacity
reviews.reviewText: I was not sure about the 85 vs 100 but 85 is enough for me., lot of room

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is brilliant for ski holidays as it protects helmets and boots inside and has more than enough room for all the other essentials.Used this for a summer holiday as well and had enough capacity for the essentials for 2 people.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Well made and not too heavy. Useful size. Internal pockets make packing easy.
Wirklich tolles Produkt, die erste Reise hat er perfekt gemeistert. Wir würden ihn wieder kaufen und können ihn mit gutem Gewissen weiterempfehlen.
